de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.itemstate

Class AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType extends AbstractExpandableListDecorator<GroupType,ChildType>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<de.mrapp.android.util.view.ViewHolder>
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.AbstractExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
        • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.enablestate.AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
          • de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.itemstate.AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    DecoratorType - The type of the decorator, which allows to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.ExpandableListAdapter, android.widget.HeterogeneousExpandableList, Adapter<android.widget.ExpandableListView>, DataStructure, Parameterizable, Restorable, ExpandableGridViewAdapter, EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableRecyclerViewAdapter, Loggable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSortableExpandableListAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType extends AbstractExpandableListDecorator<GroupType,ChildType>>
extends AbstractEnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType,DecoratorType>
implements ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    An abstract base class for all adapters, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items, which may have multiple states. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Michael Rapp
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.lang.String NUMBER_OF_CHILD_STATES_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store the number of states, the adapter's child items may have, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String SET_CHILD_STATES_IMPLICITLY_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store, whether the states of children are also set, when the state of the group, they belong to, is set, within a bundle.
      protected static java.lang.String TRIGGER_CHILD_STATE_ON_CLICK_BUNDLE_KEY
      The key, which is used to store, whether the state of a child item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, or not, within a bundle.

      • AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter

        protected AbstractItemStateExpandableListAdapter(@NonNull
                                                 android.content.Context context,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 DecoratorType decorator,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.android.util.logging.LogLevel logLevel,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 MultipleChoiceListAdapter<Group<GroupType,ChildType>> groupAdapter,
                                                 boolean allowDuplicateChildren,
                                                 boolean notifyOnChange,
                                                 boolean triggerGroupExpansionOnClick,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpandableListAdapterItemClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemClickListeners,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpandableListAdapterItemLongClickListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemLongClickListeners,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpandableListAdapterListener<GroupType,ChildType>> adapterListeners,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpansionListener<GroupType,ChildType>> expansionListeners,
                                                 boolean setChildEnableStatesImplicitly,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpandableListEnableStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> enableStateListeners,
                                                 int numberOfGroupStates,
                                                 int numberOfChildStates,
                                                 boolean triggerGroupStateOnClick,
                                                 boolean triggerChildStateOnClick,
                                                 boolean setChildStatesImplicitly,
                                                 @NonNull
                                                 de.mrapp.util.datastructure.ListenerList<ExpandableListItemStateListener<GroupType,ChildType>> itemStateListeners)
        Creates a new adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items, which may have multiple states.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, the adapter belongs to, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        decorator - The decorator, which should be used to customize the appearance of the views, which are used to visualize the group and child items of the adapter, as an instance of the generic type DecoratorType. The decorator may not be null
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used for logging, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null
        groupAdapter - The adapter, which should manage the adapter's group items, as an instance of the type MultipleChoiceListAdapter. The adapter may not be null
        allowDuplicateChildren - True, if duplicate child items, regardless from the group they belong to, should be allowed, false otherwise
        notifyOnChange - True, if the method notifyDataSetChanged():void should be automatically called when the adapter's underlying data has been changed, false otherwise
        triggerGroupExpansionOnClick - True, if a group's expansion should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        itemClickListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been clicked by the user, as an instance of the class ListenerList, or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
        itemLongClickListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item of the adapter has been long-clicked by the user, as an instance of the class ListenerList, or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
        adapterListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the adapter's underlying data has been modified, as an instance of the class ListenerList, or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
        expansionListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when a group item has been expanded or collapsed, as an instance of the class ListenerList, or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
        setChildEnableStatesImplicitly - True, if the enable states of children should be also set, when the enable state of the group, they belong to, is set
        enableStateListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when an item has been disabled or enabled, as an instance of the class ListenerList, or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
        numberOfGroupStates - The number of states, the adapter's group items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        numberOfChildStates - The number of states, the adapter's child items may have, as an Integer value. The value must be at least 1
        triggerGroupStateOnClick - True, if the state of a group item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        triggerChildStateOnClick - True, if the state of a child item should be triggered, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise
        setChildStatesImplicitly - True, if the states of children should be also set, when the state of the group, they belong to, is set, false otherwise
        itemStateListeners - A list, which contains the listeners, which should be notified, when the state of an item has been changed, as an instance of the class ListenerList or an empty list, if no listeners should be notified
